lesson.title: Welcome to the Blockchain Revolution
lesson.summary: In this lesson you are introduced to the Blockchain Revolution and get an overview of the Blockchain Developer Nanodegree program.

atoms.text:
# Welcome to the Blockchain Revolution!

Congratulations on starting your journey to become a blockchain developer.

# What is the Blockchain?

The blockchain has been described as everything from digital gold to a replacement for the internet.

This field is developing incredibly fast, and there are so many opportunities for you to get involved with.

The blockchain has the potential to revolutionize industries like finance, government, and medicine. It's even re-imagining the way we think about personal identity and security.

# What is in the Program?

Throughout this program, we'll explore all  aspects of blockchain technologies. Our goal is to help you learn the important skills you’ll need to become a blockchain developer.

We'll discuss important topics like identity, data storage, web services, and smart contracts.

You’ll learn to apply these skills in the real world, whether for a new career, to contribute to a project, or to build your very own, world changing application.

# We're here to support you

If this sounds like a lot, don't worry, that's exactly why we're so excited to join you on this journey. We're here to support you along the way as you build your own unique portfolio to show family, friends, or future employers.

So let's take a look at the journey ahead.

# The Udacity Experience

Your experience starts here in the classroom. 

This is where you'll go through video content and get hands on practice with our projects. Along the way you'll also find community and career support.

# Projects

Each project is focused developing a specific set of skills you'll need to be successful as a blockchain developer.

Our goal is to give you a deeper understanding of the background and frameworks. This will ensure you are prepared to tackle new challenges as this space continues to evolve.

To do this you'll learn core blockchain concepts and use industry leading platforms like bitcoin and ethereum. You'll then use this knowledge to explore emerging platforms like NEO, Hyperledger, Lisk, and more!

# Develop Industry Skills

By learning the skills you need to develop applications on these platforms, you’ll be able to build tools that change or create entirely new industries in ways no one has even thought of yet.

Throughout this first lesson, we’ll go into more details about the content, projects, services, and community you’ll find along the way. From there we’ll dive in and start learning!

# Welcome to the Nanodegree!

So welcome again to the Blockchain Developer Nanodegree program. We’re so excited to have you here, and we can’t wait to get started. 

See you soon!

atoms.title: L01 A03 Influence Of Blockchain V6

atoms.text: Take a look at the [course syllabus](https://classroom.udacity.com/nanodegrees/nd1309/syllabus/core-curriculum) for more information about the content and projects you'll complete throughout the Nanodegree.

## Program prerequisites

Now you are starting your journey towards becoming a Blockchain Developer, and we would like to provide you the best learning experience during this journey.

For your best learning experience, it is important that you clearly understand the programming languages, tools, and technologies we are going to use during this program.

### Prerequisites

In order to successfully finish projects and exercises in this program, you should have programming experience with  JavaScript.  Also, the Node.js framework would be extensively used in this course.

- **You should have JavaScript programming experience to be successful in this program.**

- ** You are required to use Asynchronous programming in JavaScript in this program. **

Specifically, you will use the Promises API or callbacks. In this program, we provide you with good resources to learn about asynchronous programming, but it is important you understand that we can’t provide a full course on this topic.

#### Why Asynchronous programming?

> “An asynchronous model allows multiple things to happen at the same time. When you start an action, your program continues to run. When the action finishes, the program is informed and gets access to the result (for example, the data read from disk).”
>
> From https://eloquentjavascript.net/11_async.html

This is a very important topic to know. Developers are continuously looking for ways to improve their applications with better response times, less computational resources, and low memory usage, etc. Asynchronous programming helps achieve a lot of these objectives.

In fact, most of the NPM modules you will need during this course are implemented using Promises.

- **Use of ES6 classes (Not required)**

> “JavaScript classes, introduced in ECMAScript 2015, are primarily syntactical sugar over JavaScript's existing prototype-based inheritance. The class syntax does not introduce a new object-oriented inheritance model to JavaScript.”
>
> From https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Classes

This is not a an actual prerequisite for this program as its definition suggests. But it is always good to introduce better practices, so you will find some pieces of code or exercises that use ES6 classes.

- **Node.js Web Framework (Not required)**

You will use the Node.js Web Framework to create RESTful APIs during this program, and we provide a few helpful resources to get you started with this.

# Introduction to Workspaces

Throughout this Nanodegree program, you'll have a chance to work with workspaces. 

A workspace is a development environment integrated into the Udacity Classroom. It is a sandbox for you to implement code related to the course content you've been learning.

Completing this is not required for graduation; however, we highly recommend it so you get hands-on practice to solidify what you've learned and to help you as you build your upcoming projects. 

This following section will cover:


* **Workspace Walkthrough**
* **Your Workspace**
* **Preserving Information in a Workspace**
* **Restoring Your Workspace**
* **Unable to Access Your Workspace?**

# Workspace Walkthrough

The following video will walk through:

* Navigating the file explorer
* Opening, editing, and closing files
* Working with a terminal
* Previewing your content
* Submitting your project
* Resetting the project

# Your Workspace

Your workspace is backed by a Linux virtual machine (Ubuntu). You have access to a terminal, so you have complete control over installing packages and modifying content.


Below is what your Workspace will look like:

atoms.caption: Screenshot of your Workspace. We'll go over the important bits in a second.

atoms.text:
Think of your Workspace as a normal computer:

* Open up the files you need to edit (saving is done automatically).
* Open terminal windows as necessary.
  - The terminal should start at `/home/workspace`, so make sure to `cd` to the correct directory as necessary.
* Start working
  - Start a terminal (no need to `cd` anywhere to begin)
  - Run `npm` commands (Node.js comes pre-installed)

# Preserving Information in a Workspace

The first time you open your Workspace, a new virtual machine is created just for you. Any files that you add or modify in `/home/workspace` are automatically backed up and saved. The next time you come back to the Workspace, any previous changes will be preserved.

If you don't interact with the Workspace for 30 minutes, the Workspace will be suspended. The Workspace becomes idle by any of the following:

* Not interacting with the browser tab of the Workspace
* Closing the browser tab with the Workspace
* If your laptop goes to sleep
* etc

# Restoring Your Workspace

If your Workspace has been suspended after a period of inactivity, just click the "Wake Up Workspace" button to restore it. Remember that none of your data is lost.

atoms.caption: Screenshot of workspace that has been suspended and is now idle.

atoms.text:
# Unable to Access Your Workspace?

If you are unable to access your Workspace in the Classroom it could be because you have "3rd Party Cookies" disabled in your browser. Workspaces need to set a "3rd party cookie" to enable access.

Check out this [Workspace troubleshooting FAQ](https://udacity.zendesk.com/hc/en-us/articles/115004653246) for information on how to enable 3rd party cookies for your browser.

# Practice Using a Workspace
---

In the previous concept, you were introduced to workspaces. Now's your chance to practice playing in your very first workspace!

## Let's Practice Using Your Workspace following the Steps below:

>|**Step**|**Task**|
>|------------|-----------------------------------------------|
>| Step 1 |Open up a Terminal and check your Node's version ( `node -v` ) |
>| Step 2 |Create a file newFile.js ( `touch newFile.js` )  |
>| Step 3 |Open up newFile.js from the Navigator Section|
>| Step 4 |In newFile.js, write `console.log ("Yay! I am enjoying my Blockchain Nanodegree!")`|
>| Step 5 |Run this script file in your terminal to see your message ( `node newFile.js` )|

Let’s get started!

#### Congrats!  You now know how to use Udacity's Workspaces. 

You'll be using these often throughout the program for quizzes and projects.
# What Excites You About the Blockchain?

atoms.title: What excites you about Blockchain?
tasks: Research 3 applications of blockchain (If you need a suggestion, think of a sector you’re intestered in and use that keyword search + blockchain. For example - “shoes + blockchain” or “agriculture + blockchain”.)
Post a short paragraph about each in the Student Hub.
atoms.positive_feedback: Thanks! We can't wait to see what you're excited about!
atoms.description: While blockchain has its roots in finance, its applications span far beyond. What excites you about the blockchain? Take some time to explore at least 3 applications of blockchain beyond that interest you, share about them in the forums, and read what your classmates are excited about!

atoms.text:
# Tell Us About Yourself

Now that you've met us, we would like to learn more about you.

Please fill in [this survey](https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSfaobE4QZ-ipgpymG-kPGJhCYvPPPXi_RfDyWPERb7TPvYFKA/viewform) before moving on.

# Take the Survey
This quick survey will help us learn the best ways to help you become successful in the Blockchain Developer Nanodegree Program!

# Let Us Know
We're very excited to hear from you. Let us know if you've taken time to complete the survey :)

# Lesson 2: Blockchain Basics

In **Lesson 2: Blockchain Basics** you learn the basics of Blockchain and are introduced to topics like Bitcoin to begin creating your very own blockchain identity.

We'll introduce you to what we call the **Blockchain Framework** and overview the basic components that make the blockchain work. Things like blocks, hash values, memory pools, consensus, and more will all be introduced, defined, and added to your understanding of the blockchain!
